sen.j: 豊岡県（とよおかけん）は廃藩置県により1871年（明治4年）に設置された県。
sen.e: Toyooka Prefecture is a prefecture established in 1871 based on the policy of Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures).
Toyooka Prefecture is a prefecture established in 1871 based on the policy of Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures).
Toyooka Prefecture is a prefecture established in 1871 based on the policy of Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures).

sen.j: 県庁所在地は豊岡市で、豊岡藩陣屋跡が県庁舎となった。
sen.e: The prefectural capital was Toyooka City and the remains of jinya of Toyooka Domain was used as the governmental building.
The prefectural capital was Toyooka City and the remains of Jinya of Toyooka Domain was used as the governmental building.
The prefectural capital was Toyooka City and the remains of Jinya (regional government office) of Toyooka Domain was used as the governmental building.

sen.j: 県庁跡地は現在豊岡市立図書館になっている。
sen.e: The site is now used for Toyooka City Library
The site is now used for the Toyooka City Library
The site is now used for the Toyooka City Library

sen.j: 1876年（明治9年）に分割され、兵庫県と京都府に編入された。
sen.e: Toyooka Prefecture was divided in 1876 and incorporated into Hyogo Prefecture and Kyoto Prefecture.
Toyooka Prefecture was divided in 1876 and incorporated into Hyogo Prefecture and Kyoto Prefecture.
Toyooka Prefecture was divided in 1876 and incorporated into Hyogo Prefecture and Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）7月14日：廃藩置県により豊岡藩（1.5万石）が豊岡県となる。
sen.e: July 14, 1871: Under the policy of Haihan-chiken, Toyooka Domain (15,000 koku) was reorganized as Toyooka Prefecture.
July 14, 1871: Under the policy of Haihan-chiken, Toyooka Domain (15,000 koku) was reorganized as Toyooka Prefecture.
July 14, 1871: Under the policy of Haihan-chiken, Toyooka Domain (15,000 koku) was reorganized as Toyooka Prefecture.

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）11月22日：舞鶴県や篠山県など11県16郡を豊岡県に統合。
sen.e: A total of 11 prefectures and 16 gun including Maizuru Prefecture and Sasayama Prefecture were consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture.
A total of 11 prefectures and 16 gun including Maizuru Prefecture and Sasayama Prefecture were consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture.
November 22, 1871: A total of 11 prefectures and 16 counties including Maizuru Prefecture and Sasayama Prefecture were consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: gun→counties「1871年（明治4年）11月22日：」 訳漏れ対応しました。

sen.e: August 21, 1876: Toyooka Prefecture was abolished.
August 21, 1876: Toyooka Prefecture was abolished.
August 21, 1876: Toyooka Prefecture was abolished.

sen.j: 但馬国・氷上郡・多紀郡は兵庫県へ編入。
sen.e: Tajima Province, Hikami-gun and Taki-gun were incorporated into Hyogo Prefecture.
Tajima Province, Hikami-gun and Taki-gun were incorporated into Hyogo Prefecture.
Tajima Province, Hikami County and Taki County were incorporated into Hyogo Prefecture.

sen.j: また丹後国と天田郡は京都府へ編入。
sen.e: Tango Province and Amata-gun were incorpoarted into Kyoto Prefecture.
Tango Province and Amata-gun were incorporated into Kyoto Prefecture.
Tango Province and Amata County were incorporated into Kyoto Prefecture.

tit.j: 豊岡県に統合された県

sen.e: Tajima
Tajima
Tajima

sen.j: 生野県／出石県（3万石）／豊岡県（1.5万石）／村岡県（1.1万石）
sen.e: Ikuno Prefecture/Izushi Prefecture (30,000 koku)/Toyooka Prefecture (15,000 koku)/Muraoka Prefecture (11,000 koku).

sen.j: 篠山県（6万石）／福知山県（3.2万石）／柏原県（2万石）
sen.e: Sasayama Prefecture (60,000 koku)/Fukuchiyama Prefecture (32,000 koku)/ Kaibara Prefecture (20,000 koku).
